trans-unit.source: Supports a simple iteration over an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.
This class cannot be inherited.
Enumerators provide read-only access to the data in a collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Reset%2A> resets the enumerator to this position.
At this position, calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Current%2A>.
This class inherits from <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
See the class for more information about enumerating over a collection.
Gets the current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.

Current does not move the position of the enumerator and consecutive calls to Current return the same object until either <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
The current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.
The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
Advances the enumerator to the next element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.
This method advances the enumerator to the next element in the collection.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator> class inherits from <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>; see this class for more information on using enumerators.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.
The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.
Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.
An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged.

If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or Reset throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.
Gets the current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.

<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Current%2A> does not move the position of the enumerator and consecutive calls to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Current%2A> return the same object until either <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementEnumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
The current element in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection"></xref>.
The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
